sentence.Network_en: The legislative body had voted to oust the country's onetime rulers.
sentence.Network_cn: 立法机构通过投票将该国的前度领导人赶下了台。

sentence.Network_en: The president has gone along with the hardliners lest they be tempted to oust him.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统同意了强硬派的意见，以免他们产生赶他下台的念头。

sentence.Network_en: Last week they tried to oust him in a parliamentary vote of no confidence.
sentence.Network_cn: 上周，他们试图通过议会的不信任投票将他罢免。

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE 同义词总结大全 ... banish v 放逐，摒弃 | oust v 逐出,夺取,驱逐 exclude v. 排斥，排除 |.
英语单词造句（难，使用翻译机者勿入）_百度知道 ... mandatory 义务的;强制的 oust 驱逐,撵走；剥夺 proverbial 出名的,众所周知的.
英语专业八级核心词汇_普特英语听力 ... ostentatious adj 装饰表面的卖弄的 oust vt 剥夺取代驱逐 overt adj 明显的公然的.
淡淡的英文单词怎么写？-外语-天涯问答 ... needy a. 贫困的 oust vt. 轰，撵 pauper n. 贫民，穷人.

list.abs: SADC at military intervention to return the ousted president , Marc Ravalomanana , to power ., 南非发展共同体表示有可能进行军事干涉 , 以使被罢免总统马克 ? 拉瓦卢马纳纳恢复原职.
Television has not ousted radios ., 电视机还未能取代收音机.
... country's first democratically elected president.迫走某人出局oust somebody重返政坛step into politics again
The ousted politician walked in a careful manner ., 这个下台的政治家走路很从容.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a legal term): from Anglo-Norman French ouster 'take away', from Latin obstare 'oppose, hinder'

entry.def: If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it.

example.ex: The leaders have been ousted from power by nationalists...
example.tran: 这些领导人被民族主义者赶下了台。

example.ex: Last week they tried to oust him in a parliamentary vote of no confidence.
example.tran: 上周，他们试图通过议会的不信任投票将他罢免。

means.word_mean: 1. remove from a position or office;

sentences.sentence: "The chairman was ousted after he misappropriated funds"
"The word processor has ousted the typewriter"

auth_sentence.content: His sanguine indifference to...efforts to oust him from his job.
auth_sentence.res_content: His sanguine indifference to...efforts to oust him from his job.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His sanguine indifference to...efforts to oust him from his job.

auth_sentence.content: Ming troops oust the Mongols from Dadu - present-day Beijing.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ming troops oust the Mongols from Dadu - present-day Beijing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ming troops oust the Mongols from Dadu - present-day Beijing.

auth_sentence.content: We were going to ask the world to help oust Pinochet.
auth_sentence.res_content: We were going to ask the world to help oust Pinochet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We were going to ask the world to help oust Pinochet.

means.word_mean: 驱逐, 革职, 罢黜

sentences.en: The politician was ousted from office by a vote from members of his own party.
sentences.cn: 那个政客被他自己党内的成员投票表决赶下台。

jushi.english: The rebels finally managed to oust the government from power.
jushi.chinese: 反叛者最后总算夺取了政权。
他的主席职务被革除了。

jushi.english: The politician was ousted from office by a vote from members of his own party.
jushi.chinese: 那个政客被他自己党内的成员投票表决赶下台。
